means: 迷住（某人），迷惑( captivate的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: For 40 years she has captivated the world with her radiant looks.
sentence.Network_cn: 40年来，她那令人惊艳的美貌让全世界为之痴迷。

sentence.Network_en: I was captivated by her brilliant mind.
The children were captivated by her stories.
sentence.Network_cn: 孩子们被她的故事迷住了。

lost with you , captivated by you ., 迷失于你 , 受惑于你.
i am captivated , i am ., 我被迷惑了.

entry.def: If you are captivated by someone or something, you find them fascinating and attractive.

example.ex: I was captivated by her brilliant mind...
For 40 years she has captivated the world with her radiant looks.
example.tran: 40年来,她那令人惊艳的美貌让全世界为之痴迷。
